{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = ASUS USB-N53.jpg |image1_size = 150px |caption = Dual-Band Wireless-N600 USB Adapter |caption2 = |pp = http://www.asus.com/Networks/Wireless_Adapters/USBN53_B1 |sp = https://www.asus.com/Networking/USBN53_B1/HelpDesk/ |dl = https://www.asus.com/Networking/USBN53_B1/HelpDesk_Download/ |wikidevi = ASUS_USB-N53_B1 |wikipedia = |brand = ASUS |model = USB-N53 |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = B1 |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = June 23, 2015 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/ASUS_USB-N53_B1 |sernum = |wlclass = AN600 |series = |if = USB |if_bus_version = 3.0 |ifconnector = Male A |formfactor = dongle |vendor_id = 0b05 |device_id = 180b |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = MSQ-USBN53B1 |icid = |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = |chip1 = MediaTek;MT7612U; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = |antenna = |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |802.11n = 300/300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = |802dot11_protocols = abgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = 12/01/2014 |price = |upc = 610839393602 |ean = 4719543393604 |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B005SAKW9G |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = China |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== Since this adapter contains a [[MediaTek]] MT7612U, it probably supports :(AC1200) 802.11abgn+ac despite being advertised as N600. {{See also|Netgear A6210}} ==Links of Interest== *[https://askubuntu.com/questions/654262/missing-driver-for-asus-usb-n53 ''Missing driver for ASUS USB-N53?'' on '''Ask Ubuntu'''] 
Bus 001 Device 003: ID 0b05:180b ASUSTek Computer, Inc.

kernel: usb 1-3: New USB device found, idVendor=0b05, idProduct=180b
kernel: usb 1-3: New USB device strings: Mfr=1, Product=2, SerialNumber=3
kernel: usb 1-3: Product: 802.11ac WLAN
kernel: usb 1-3: Manufacturer: MediaTek Inc.
kernel: usb 1-3: SerialNumber: 000000000
:[https://github.com/openwrt/mt76 mt76] and [https://github.com/jurobystricky/Netgear-A6210 ''Netgear-A6210''] drivers is recommended for Linux *[https://www.raspberrypi.org/forums/viewtopic.php?t=142500 ''Finding a working Wi-Fi USB dongle'' on '''Raspberry Pi''' Forums] :''Product: 802.11ac WLAN'' [[Category:English Documentation]]
